citation.article-title: Agromyces terreus sp. nov., isolated from soil.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Agromyces terreus sp. nov.
Agromyces terreus (ter′re.us. L. masc. adj. terreus of the earth).
Cells are Gram-positive, curved or straight rods, 0.2–0.5×0.7–5.0 μm.
Non-motile.
Strict aerobe.
Colonies on TSA are circular, convex, smooth, glistening, cream-coloured and 0.8–1.2 mm in diameter after 3 days incubation at 25 °C.
Growth occurs at 10 and 35 °C with an optimum temperature of 25 °C, but not at 4 or 36 °C.
Optimal pH for growth is between 7.0 and 8.0; growth occurs at pH 5.0 and 10.0, but not at pH 4.5 or 10.5.
Growth occurs in the presence of 0–6.0 % (w/v) NaCl with optimum growth in the presence of 0.5–1.0 % (w/v) NaCl.
Tweens 20, 40 and 60 are hydrolysed.
Arginine decarboxylase, lysine decarboxylase, ornithine decarboxylase and tryptophan deaminase are absent.

The following substrates are assimilated: glycerol, phenylacetate, d-arabinose, l-arabinose, d-xylose, galactose, glucose, fructose, mannose, rhamnose, N-acetylglucosamine, amygdalin, arbutin, aesculin, salicin, cellobiose, maltose, sucrose, trehalose, inulin, raffinose, starch, glycogen, gentiobiose, turanose and l-fucose.

The following substrates are not assimilated: caprate, adipate, erythritol, ribose, l-xylose, adonitol, methyl β-d-xyloside, sorbose, dulcitol, inositol, mannitol, sorbitol, methyl α-d-mannoside, methyl α-d-glucoside, lactose, melibiose, melezitose, xylitol, d-lyxose, d-tagatose, d-fucose, d-arabitol, l-arabitol, gluconate, 2-ketogluconate and 5-ketogluconate.

Acid is produced from aesculin and 5-ketogluconate, but not from erythritol, l-xylose, adonitol, methyl β-d-xyloside, sorbose, dulcitol, inositol, sorbitol, methyl α-d-mannoside, methyl α-d-glucoside, melezitose, xylitol, d-lyxose, d-tagatose, d-fucose, d-arabitol, l-arabitol, gluconate or 2-ketogluconate.

In assays with the API ZYM system, esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), leucine arylamidase, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase and α-glucosidase are present and acid phosphatase and N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase are weakly present, but trypsin and α-fucosidase are absent.
Susceptible to chloramphenicol, cephalothin, gentamicin, tetracycline, carbenicillin, neomycin and oleandomycin, but not to lincomycin.
The cell-wall peptidoglycan type is B2γ, d-Glu–d-Dab.
Cell-wall sugars are galactose and ribose.
The predominant menaquinones are MK-11, MK-12 and MK-10.
Major cellular fatty acids (>10 % of total fatty acids) are anteiso-C15 : 0, anteiso-C17 : 0, iso-C16 : 0 and iso-C15 : 0.
Major polar lipids are diphosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylglycerol and an unidentified glycolipid.
The DNA G+C content is 71.1 mol%.
The type strain, DS-10T (=KCTC 19216T =JCM 14581T), was isolated from a soil of Dokdo, Korea.
